title: Unable to send or receive messages through the Messages app on Android 10
content:
I installed Android 10 on my Pixel 3 on Sunday, and it was functioning just fine for a while. I was able to send and receive SMS messages through the messages app.

Yesterday, upon sending a text, my phone shut off and went into a boot loop. I was able to get the phone back on by booting into recovery mode. This happened a few more times when trying to send texts, but it eventually stopped. Now when I attempt to send a message through the Messages app, it disappears and does not send.

If I have the Messages app set as default, I will not receive texts whatsoever.

If I use the Verizon "Message+" app, I can send and receive SMS and MMS messages just fine.

Troubleshooting steps I have already tried:
- Delete app cache and app data for Messages app
- Delete app cache and app data for all SMS/MMS/messaging related apps
- Rebooting the phone
- Removing and reinserting my SIM card

I feel as though this issue might be related to chat features, because the settings sometimes says "Chat features are not available for this device." If I switch my default sms app to Message+, then back to Messages, I can enable chat features and I can send and receive texts for about 30 seconds. Then the app goes back to not allowing me to send or receive anything. 

Kind of bummed that I can't use such a basic smartphone application on Google's latest phone on their latest OS. But at least I can work around this for now with a different default SMS app.

Any help would be appreciated!
